context.p: The control system has a discrete menu that installing contractors and/or service agents can access to enter contact information for their customers. This contact information will be displayed with all fault and alert messages.

step.cmd: From the Desktop screen, press and hold down the middle (unmarked) multifunction button for 30 seconds, and then release it. See .

stepresult.p: This will launch a discrete menu where personalized contact information can be entered.

step.cmd: Using the UP and DOWN buttons, select (highlighted in black) the Show Contact Information menu item.
Press the multifunction button under CHANGE to activate the adjustment mode for this parameter.

stepresult.p: With the adjustment mode for Show Contact Information activated, the selection bar will change from a black fill to a black outline.

step.cmd: Use the Up and Down buttons to change the setting from No to Yes, and the press the multifunction button under UPDATE to save the new setting.

info.note: The Access Code at the bottom of the Service Contact Information screen is for manufacturing engineering purposes only. There are no user settings or information accessed through this menu item.

step.cmd: Using the UP and DOWN buttons, select (highlighted in black) the Change Contact Name menu item.
Press the multifunction button under SELECT to open the Change Contact Name menu.
Follow the on-screen instructions to enter your name or the name of your company. There is a maximum of 20 character spaces for this purpose.
When finished, press the multifunction button under UPDATE to save the new Contact Name. The control system will return to the discrete menu.
Using the UP and DOWN buttons, select (highlighted in black) the Change Contact Phone menu item and press the multifunction button under SELECT.
Follow the on-screen instructions to enter a new Contact Phone number and press the multifunction button under UPDATE to save the new phone number.
When the new Contact Name and Contact Phone number have both been updated, press the multifunction button under BACK to return to the Desktop screen.
